TITLE.P: Bags and Sacks for the Collection Food Waste, Plastic Packaging, Paper Waste and Extra Sacks

SHORT_DESCR.P: The aim of the procurement is to enter into a framework agreement for the delivery of the following products for use in the municipal waste/source sorting scheme in Bærum municipality.
Product 1: Green bags for food waste.
Product 2: Large green bags for food waste, for industrial kitchens.
Product 3: Option: Strong blue bags for waste suction for plastic packaging.
Product 4: Option: Strong green bags for waste suction for food waste.
Product 5: Blue extra sacks for residual waste.
Product 6: Sacks for plastic packaging, clear/perforated.
Product 7: Large sacks for Ecco containers for plastic packaging.
Product 8: Orange sacking/reused sacks for cardboard/paper/cartons.

See the short description II.1.4. See the tender documentation, requirement specifications and other annexes for a detailed description of the sacks and bags in the sanitation scheme in Bærum municipality, which has approx. 125,000 inhabitants.
In 2017, Bærum municipality introduced a new source sorting scheme with separate sorting for food waste from the municipality´s inhabitants.
The contract period is 2 years, with an option for a 1 year + 1 year extension. See the requirement specifications and price form for further information on the extent and amount.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for a contract extension for 1 year plus 1 year.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Option for green and blue bags for waste suction, see the requirement specifications and tender documentation.

INFO_ADD.P: See the tender documentation and annexes for information on the procurement and the deliveries, etc.

SUITABILITY.P: The service provider shall have their tax and VAT payments in order. Tax and VAT certificates must be submitted, see the tender documentation.
A certificate for tax and VAT issued by either the local tax office or the tax collection office where the tenderer's head office is located. The certificate can be obtained from Altinn.no.
The certificates shall not be older than 6 months, from the tender deadline.
Norwegian tenderers who are not subject to VAT must provide confirmation of this from the National Tax Board.
Foreign tenderers must provide certificates from equivalent authorities to the Norwegian authorities.
Tenderers shall be a legally established company. The following must be submitted: Norwegian companies: Company registration certificate.
Foreign companies: Verification that the company is registered in a trade or business register as prescribed by the law of the country where the tenderer is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The company’s revised annual accounts for the last 2 years.

Extended credit rating/report, not older than 3 months, from a publicly certified credit company, which includes a credit rating of the tenderer — typically given by a letter or a short text, as well as an explanation of this. The report shall be based on the last known accounting figures. The date must be clear.

Companies without sufficient credit rating, newly started companies with a credit rating of AN, individual foreign companies or companies without reporting obligation to the Brønnøysund Register Centre will not always be able to document that the requirement is met. In such instances, they will be able to compensate with a satisfactory credit rating which provides an equivalent security for implementation ability. These alternative documents must be included with the tender.

If the tenderer has valid reasons for not being able to provide the documentation requested by the Contracting Authority, the tenderer can prove the economic and financial position with any other document that the Contracting Authority deems suitable.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: The tenderer is required to be financially solvent, which gives the Contracting Authority the security that the tenderer will be financially viable throughout the period of the agreement.
A creditworthiness of A (creditworthy) is required to be eligible for this competition. Tenderers with a lower rating will be rejected.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Description of the tenderer´s most relevant contracts in the last 3 years, including information on the value and date, and the name of the public or private recipient, with contact information for possible reference collection.
Certificates for both standards must be presented.
If a tenderer is not certified, other documentation that the Contracting Authority can accept and that confirms fulfilment of the requirement must be presented.
Foreign tenderers must enclose documentation that confirms that they fulfil equivalent requirements.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Good experience is required from equivalent assignments.
Tenderers must have a good and well-functioning quality and environmental management system, in accordance with ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 or equivalent.

If a tenderer will use sub-supplier(s) for fulfilment of the qualification requirements for the tenderer's economic and financial position and the tenderer's technical and professional qualifications, a commitment statement must be presented stating that the tenderer can use the sub-supplier(s)' capacity, see annex 7 — Commitment Statement. Tenderers must, in addition, state in the ESPD form, Part II point C, that they will rely on sub-suppliers to fulfil the qualification requirements. In addition, sub-suppliers must fill in and submit annex 8 — Self-declaration form as documentation of fulfilment of the qualification requirements.

Tenderers must also state whether they intend to use sub-suppliers to fulfil the contract. Any use of sub-suppliers to fulfil the contract must be stated in the ESPD form Part II point D. Information shall be provided in the form on the name and organisation number of sub-supplier(s) and which parts of the service each sub-supplier shall carry out.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: See the tender documentation and annexes.

INFO_ADD.P: See the tender documentation and annexes for information, a description and requirements, etc.
